name: Test User Role Insertion
sql: INSERT INTO Users (username, password, email, role) VALUES ('test_user', 'password123', 'test@example.com', 'admin');
rationale: Ensure a user can be inserted with the new role.

name: Test Role Column Not Null Constraint
sql: INSERT INTO Users (username, password, email) VALUES ('test_user_no_role', 'password123', 'test_no_role@example.com');
rationale: Check that users can be inserted without specifying a role, ensuring role is optional.

name: Test Role Value Retrieval
sql: SELECT role FROM Users WHERE username = 'test_user';
rationale: Verify that the role can be retrieved correctly after insertion.

name: Test Unique Role Assignment
sql: INSERT INTO Users (username, password, email, role) VALUES ('test_user2', 'password123', 'test2@example.com', 'editor');
rationale: Ensure that distinct users can have distinct roles assigned.

name: Test Existing User Role Update
sql: UPDATE Users SET role = 'manager' WHERE username = 'test_user';
rationale: Check that the role can be updated for an existing user.
